description: Additive bases: a(n) is the least integer k such that in the cyclic group Z_k there is a subset of n elements all pairs (of distinct elements) of which add up to a different sum (in Z_k).
references: R. L. Graham and N. J. A. Sloane, On Additive Bases and Harmonious Graphs, SIAM J. Algebraic and Discrete Methods, 1 (1980), 382-404.
H. Haanpaa, A. Huima and P. R. J. Ostergard, Sets in Z_n with Distinct Sums of Pairs, in Optimal discrete structures and algorithms (ODSA 2000). Discrete Appl. Math. 138 (2004), no. 1-2, 99-106.
N. J. A. Sloane and Simon Plouffe, The Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences, Academic Press, 1995 (includes this sequence).

Illinois, 2013, pages 131-144, (in English and Russian) [gives the term 183]. - _N. J. A. Sloane_, Nov 24 2013
example: a(4)=6: the set {0,1,2,4} is such a subset of Z_6, since 0+1, 0+2, 0+4, 1+2, 1+4 and 2+4 are all distinct in Z_6; also, no such 4-element set exists in any smaller cyclic group.
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_
